Description:
Only one resume, Please share local Candidates with bi-lingual (English/Spanish).

Title: Business Systems Analyst: II (Intermediate)

Location: (Hybrid) 2 Morrissey Boulevard, Dorchester MA 02125

Duration: 7+ months, extensions, possible conversion

Must Have


3-5 years
Bilingual Spanish/English
Availability for working on weekends, holidays, evenings as needed.
Certifications: ITIL 4, Scrum Master or Scrum Product Owner
Technical experience required: ability to run intermediate to complex queries, knowledge of DevOps, Continuous Delivery Applications (such as Jenkins Pipeline), Jira, Confluence.
Payments experience: Awareness of end to end payments workflow, including accounting, GL, debits, credits.
Ability to work successfully in a highly regulated industry.
Attend project meetings to gather all the information about forecasted changes.
Provide training to your team members how to create and properly document changes.
Guidance on the Change Management process to avoid back and forth in change submissions.


Core Requirements


3-5 years
Bilingual Spanish/English
Availability for working on weekends, holidays, evenings as needed.
Certifications: ITIL 4, Scrum Master or Scrum Product Owner
Technical experience required: ability to run intermediate to complex queries, knowledge of DevOps, Continuous Delivery Applications (such as Jenkins Pipeline), Jira, Confluence.
Payments experience: Awareness of end to end payments workflow, including accounting, GL, debits, credits.
Ability to work successfully in a highly regulated industry.
Attend project meetings to gather all the information about forecasted changes.
Provide training to your team members how to create and properly document changes.
Guidance on the Change Management process to avoid back and forth in change submissions.
Coordinate escalations with the technical execution team to expedite time response.
Review with other CIOs the schedule for changes to PRO to avoid collisions and prioritize just in case (for this I’ll require allocated resources for the rest of CIOs).
Leading the change management activities within a structured process framework.
Evaluating the change impact and organizational readiness to limit potential risk.
Managing the change portfolio, which allows the organization to prepare for and successfully adopt the change.
Authorize minor change requests and coordinate with the Change Advisory Board for changes presenting higher risk.
Conduct post-implementation reviews to assess the decisions and performance related to the change request.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Excellent analytical skills
Structured thinking
Experience in coordinating cross-functional work teams up to task completion


Nice To Haves


Thorough knowledge of technical change management workflows / processing
Ability to handle software infrastructure management & configuration management


Description Of Work/Position


The Change Management role will be dedicated to supporting implementations specific to payments programs- including projects that will transform payments off of existing applications to a new payment hub.
As part of the Change Management area, this role is focused on software changes, release management, changes to middleware application and mainframe interfaces as they relate to payments.
Release / change management role will focus on the fine details of assembling different interrelated components and streamline the release and change management process. To satisfy a complex or solution-based release. Release managers coordinate with different stakeholders for requirements, testing, and release calendar of necessary components. They ensure a synchronous running of day-to-day processes and coordinate and execute the change management documentation and process for the payment’s IT team. The resource will have a background in conducting structured change efforts for software changes. Managing the development of deliverables and changes into test and production environments.

Title: Business Systems Analyst: II (Intermediate)

Location: (Hybrid) 2 Morrissey Boulevard, Dorchester MA 02125

Duration: 7+ months, extensions, possible conversion

Must Have

  • 3-5 years
  • Bilingual Spanish/English
  • Availability for working on weekends, holidays, evenings as needed.
  • Certifications: ITIL 4, Scrum Master or Scrum Product Owner
  • Technical experience required: ability to run intermediate to complex queries, knowledge of DevOps, Continuous Delivery Applications (such as Jenkins Pipeline), Jira, Confluence.
  • Payments experience: Awareness of end to end payments workflow, including accounting, GL, debits, credits.
  • Ability to work successfully in a highly regulated industry.
  • Attend project meetings to gather all the information about forecasted changes.
  • Provide training to your team members how to create and properly document changes.
  • Guidance on the Change Management process to avoid back and forth in change submissions.

Core Requirements

  • 3-5 years
  • Bilingual Spanish/English
  • Availability for working on weekends, holidays, evenings as needed.
  • Certifications: ITIL 4, Scrum Master or Scrum Product Owner
  • Technical experience required: ability to run intermediate to complex queries, knowledge of DevOps, Continuous Delivery Applications (such as Jenkins Pipeline), Jira, Confluence.
  • Payments experience: Awareness of end to end payments workflow, including accounting, GL, debits, credits.
  • Ability to work successfully in a highly regulated industry.
  • Attend project meetings to gather all the information about forecasted changes.
  • Provide training to your team members how to create and properly document changes.
  • Guidance on the Change Management process to avoid back and forth in change submissions.
  • Coordinate escalations with the technical execution team to expedite time response.
  • Review with other CIOs the schedule for changes to PRO to avoid collisions and prioritize just in case (for this I’ll require allocated resources for the rest of CIOs).
  • Leading the change management activities within a structured process framework.
  • Evaluating the change impact and organizational readiness to limit potential risk.
  • Managing the change portfolio, which allows the organization to prepare for and successfully adopt the change.
  • Authorize minor change requests and coordinate with the Change Advisory Board for changes presenting higher risk.
  • Conduct post-implementation reviews to assess the decisions and performance related to the change request.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Excellent analytical skills
  • Structured thinking
  • Experience in coordinating cross-functional work teams up to task completion

Nice To Haves

  • Thorough knowledge of technical change management workflows / processing
  • Ability to handle software infrastructure management & configuration management
